TopicTitle: Manual target on Kerbin (out of contracts)

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

 

In order to learn how to land a plane, and in order to discover Kerbin surface, I need to be able to manually target a point on the planet.

We can easily do it when the point is defined by a contract, but I don't know how to define manually a point myself where I think I can land without dangers.

 

Do you know how I should do it?

Thanks

1 hour ago, Philae & Rosetta said:

Hi all,

 

In order to learn how to land a plane, and in order to discover Kerbin surface, I need to be able to manually target a point on the planet.

We can easily do it when the point is defined by a contract, but I don't know how to define manually a point myself where I think I can land without dangers.

 

Do you know how I should do it?

Thanks

You can use Kerbnet to set up a custom way point.

Just use a probe core that has Kerbnet access.

Or you can get the Waypoint Manager mod, which pretty much does the same thing, sans the need for Kerbnet.

 

Edited January 6, 2018 by Rocket In My Pocket

5 minutes ago, Rocket In My Pocket said:

You can use Kerbnet to set up a custom way point.

Just use a probe core that has Kerbnet access.

Or you can get the Waypoint Manager mod, which pretty much does the same thing, sans Kerbnet.

Kerbnet is still a bit of a mystery to me. I feel like I've barely scratched the surface of its usefulness. I really need to explore it's capabilities a bit more.
